events.event_description: U.S. crude oil production reached a record monthly high of over 13.3 million barrels per day, setting both a domestic and global record.
events.citation: Average monthly U.S. crude oil production established a monthly record high in December 2023 at more than 13.3 million b/d.

events.event_description: Saudi Aramco canceled its plans to increase production capacity to 13.0 million barrels per day by 2027.
events.citation: Saudi Arabia's state-owned Saudi Aramco recently scrapped plans to increase production capacity to 13.0 million b/d by 2027.

events.event_description: Russia announced additional voluntary oil production cuts of 500,000 barrels per day following OPEC+ production cuts.
events.citation: Russia was among the OPEC+ countries that announced production cuts in November 2022, and in February 2023, it separately announced additional voluntary cuts of 500,000 b/d.

events.event_description: Saudi Arabia reduced crude oil production by about 900,000 barrels per day due to OPEC+ cuts and additional voluntary cuts.
events.citation: In 2023, crude oil production in Saudi Arabia declined by about 900,000 b/d because of OPEC+ cuts and further voluntary cuts Saudi Arabia made to offset weaker demand growth.

events.event_description: U.S. achieved record annual crude oil production of 12.9 million barrels per day, surpassing its previous record of 12.3 million b/d from 2019.
events.citation: Crude oil production in the United States, including condensate, averaged 12.9 million barrels per day (b/d) in 2023, breaking the previous U.S. and global record of 12.3 million b/d, set in 2019.
